question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: incentive_v3_version_migrate()] [Version Rollback] Can the version check at line 95 be bypassed by manipulating incentive_v3::version() to equal this_version(), preventing necessary migrations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: incentive_v3_version_migrate()] [State Corruption] If version_migrate is called multiple times with increasing versions, can intermediate state be corrupted by skipping migration steps? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: incentive_v3_version_migrate()] [Authorization] What prevents malicious admin from migrating to incompatible future versions, causing protocol-wide incentive system failure? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: create_incentive_v3_pool()] [Asset ID Mismatch] Can attacker create incentive pool with mismatched generic type T and asset_id, similar to flash loan type confusion? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: create_incentive_v3_pool()] [Duplicate Creation] What prevents creating multiple incentive pools for the same asset_id, causing reward distribution conflicts? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: create_incentive_v3_rule()] [Option Validation] Is the 'option' parameter at line 128 validated against allowed values, or can invalid options create exploitable rule states? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: create_incentive_v3_rule()] [Clock Manipulation] Can attacker manipulate Clock parameter to create rules with future/past timestamps, gaming reward distribution timing? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: enable_incentive_v3_by_rule_id()] [Rule ID Validation] What prevents enabling non-existent rule_id, potentially activating invalid reward rules? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: disable_incentive_v3_by_rule_id()] [DoS Attack] Can malicious IncentiveOwnerCap holder disable all rules to halt reward distribution as denial-of-service? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: enable_incentive_v3_by_rule_id()] [Type Safety] Does the generic type T at line 132 match the rule's reward coin type, or can mismatched types cause accounting errors? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: set_incentive_v3_reward_rate_by_rule_id()] [Integer Overflow] Can total_supply * duration_ms overflow u64 in rate calculations, creating extreme reward rates? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: set_incentive_v3_reward_rate_by_rule_id()] [Division by Zero] If duration_ms is 0, can this cause division-by-zero when calculating per-second reward rate? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: set_incentive_v3_reward_rate_by_rule_id()] [Economic Attack] Can admin set total_supply to u64::MAX and duration_ms to 1ms to drain reward fund instantly? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: set_incentive_v3_reward_rate_by_rule_id()] [Storage Mutation] Is the Storage parameter at line 140 incorrectly mutable, allowing unintended state modifications beyond reward rate updates? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: set_incentive_v3_max_reward_rate_by_rule_id()] [Constraint Bypass] Can max_total_supply be set to 0 to bypass rate limits, or to u64::MAX to allow unlimited rewards? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: set_incentive_v3_max_reward_rate_by_rule_id()] [Inconsistent State] If max rate is set below current reward rate, does the system enforce immediate adjustment or allow over-limit distribution? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: set_incentive_v3_borrow_fee_rate()] [Rate Bounds] Can rate parameter exceed 100% (assuming bps), causing borrowers to pay more in fees than principal borrowed? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: set_incentive_v3_borrow_fee_rate()] [Fee Extraction] Can malicious admin set fee rate to maximum to extract excessive value from borrowers during high-demand periods? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Multiple Functions] [Race Condition] Can admin call multiple setter functions in rapid succession (e.g., rates, min, max) to create temporarily inconsistent flash loan config that can be exploited? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Multiple Functions] [Privilege Escalation] If StorageAdminCap and IncentiveOwnerCap can be obtained through different paths, can attacker combine privileges to perform unauthorized actions? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [create_flash_loan_asset() + create_incentive_v3_pool()] [Asset Linking] Can flash loan asset and incentive pool be created for same asset_id with different type parameters T, causing accounting mismatches? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [deposit_incentive_v3_reward_fund() + withdraw_incentive_v3_reward_fund()] [Fund Drain] Can attacker deposit minimum amount, then admin immediately withdraws maximum, draining rewards without proper distribution? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [All Flash Loan Functions] [Config Corruption] Can flash loan config be partially initialized (e.g., asset created but rates not set), leaving protocol in unsafe state? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: set_flash_loan_asset_rate_to_supplier()] [Generic Type] Can attacker call with T=any type to create flash loan config entries for non-existent assets, corrupting config mapping? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/manage.move] [Function: create_incentive_v3_reward_fund()] [Type Instantiation] Can multiple reward funds be created for same type T, causing reward distribution conflicts? (Medium)
